page.title: 03Farming Today.
page.content: Dairy farming is now the main source of income.There are approximately 700 acres of grass,silage and hay,150 acres of corn, 50 acres of fodder beet with 40 acres of turnip providing winter fodder for the herds.There are three large dairy units at Henshears, Bickham and Gilles. The change from beef to dairy cattle was as a direct result of government financial incentives but as government has introduced milk quotas which are expected to be reduced beef is being reintroduced. Wheat and barley are also grown wheat as a cash crop and barley for use on the farms the resulting straw is also used on the farms. In October any remaining grass is let for sheep grazing.
